net.akami.mask.core

Class MaskContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.akami.mask.core.MaskContext

  • public class MaskContext
extends java.lang.Object
    Definer of a calculation environment, required to perform any operation on expressions.

    A context (or environment) allows you to customize different calculations.

    You are free to add some support for mathematical patterns that are not supported by the library, or, on the other hand, remove some undesired features provided by default, which will make your calculations run faster.

    Furthermore, the environment gives you a total control over inputs and outputs, which means that a single expression can merge in different outcomes. You will for instance be able to decide whether 5/2 will remain 5/2 or will be reduced as 2.5.

    For further information about inputs and outputs alteration, see CalculationAlteration and AlterationHandler. 

    

 The MaskContext class handles :

      
  •  A set of BinaryOperationHandlers. Basically, the 5 default operations, being the addition, the
      subtraction, the multiplication, the division and the power calculation. Although this is not recommended,
      you are free to remove any of these operations, if you are guaranteed that they won't be required. However,
      because your expression doesn't literally contain a given operation doesn't mean it is not required. For
      instance, the power calculator requires the multiplier to work, since it basically chains multiplications a given
      amount of times. 
    
      Note : binary operations take care of the alteration system. You can directly modify the handlers, or add your owns
      with different affections. 
    
      
  •  A set of MathFunctions. Only the mathematical functions present in the set wil be supported.
      Mathematical functions can require multiple arguments. See MathFunction's documentation for further
      information 
    
      
  •  A list of ValidityCheck. They analyze the given input and throw an error if the input is invalid
      mathematically speaking. 
    
      
  •  A MathContext, used to define the amount of significant digits for calculations.
  




Author:


Antoine Tran

      Constructor Detail
      




        

      • 

        MaskContext
        

        public MaskContext()
        

        Constructs a context with the default parameters. The set of BinaryOperationHandlers will be generated
 from BinaryOperationHandler.generateDefaultHandlers(MaskContext), the set of mathematical functions
 will be generated from MathFunction.generateDefaultFunctions(MaskContext), and the MathContext will
 use a 100 digits precision.
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        MaskContext
        

        public MaskContext(int precision)
        

        Constructs a context with the given precision. 
        
 See MaskContext() for further information concerning the other handled data.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        precision - the amount of significant digits handled by the context
        

        

        • 

      

      •

      Method Detail
      






        

      • 

        binaryCompute
        

        public <T> T binaryCompute(T a,
                           T b,
                           java.lang.Class<? extends BinaryOperationHandler<T>> clazz)
        

        Performs a calculation from the two elements given and the selected operator. 
        
 By default (recommended), the 5 operations (+-*/^) are available. This method is generally called
 from the MathUtils class
        

        

        Type Parameters:
        

        T - the binary operator's handled type. All default operators use the Expression type
        

        Parameters:
        

        a - the first element to compute with the second one
        

        b - the second element to compute with the first one
        

        clazz - the type of the binary operator in charge of the calculation
        

        Returns:
        

        a result computed by the operator from the two elements given
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        getBinaryOperation
        

        public <T extends BinaryOperationHandler> T getBinaryOperation(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        

        Returns the instance of a required operator, allowing the user to call other methods than
 the default BinaryOperationHandler.operate(Object, Object) from it. 
        
 If you are looking forward to using the operate() method from an operator, use binaryCompute(Object, Object, Class)
 instead.
        

        

        Type Parameters:
        

        T - the generic type to avoid casting
        

        Parameters:
        

        clazz - the type of the operator
        

        Returns:
        

        the supported operator whose Object.getClass() method equals the clazz parameter.
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        getFunctionByBinding
        

        public java.util.Optional<MathFunction> getFunctionByBinding(char binding)
        

        Returns the mathematical function matching the given binding. Since two functions are equals as long as their
 binding is similar, there can be only one function matching it, because the functions are grouped in a set.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        binding - the given binding, supposed to match a single function present in the set
        

        Returns:
        

        an Optional.empty() if the binding does not match anything, otherwise Optional.of(Object),
 the parameter being the matched function.
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        getFunctionByExpression
        

        public java.util.Optional<MathFunction> getFunctionByExpression(java.lang.String self)
        

        Goes through the given input, and tries to match every char with a mathematical function. The first matched function
 found is returned.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        self - the given input
        

        Returns:
        

        the first function that matches a char from the input
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        addHandler
        

        public void addHandler(BinaryOperationHandler<Expression> handler)
        

        Adds a new handler to the set. Only BinaryOperationHandlers with Expression as generic type
 are supported.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        handler - a new handler to add
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        removeHandler
        

        public void removeHandler(java.lang.Class<? extends BinaryOperationHandler<Expression>> clazz)
        

        Removes the handler from the set whose Object.getClass() method equals the clazz parameter
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        clazz - the class type to remove
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        addFunction
        

        public void addFunction(MathFunction target)
        

        Adds a new function to the set. 
        
 Note that the new function will replace any existing function whose binding would match with the new function's.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        target - a new function to add
